Instrument Response¶

Introduction¶

A function is provided to allow convolution of simulated time-resolved populations with a gaussian IRF.

API¶

toolkit.convolve_irf(y, fwhm, shift_max_to_zero=False, normalise=False)¶

Perform a convolution with a gaussian IRF.

Parameters

  • t (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array containing the original time points.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array to convolve with the IRF.

  • fwhm (float) – Full width half maximum of the IRF in same time units as t.

  • shift_max_to_zero (bool) – If True, the result will be shifted such that it is maximal at t = 0. The default is False.

  • normalise (bool) – If True, the result will be normalised to its maximum value. The default is False.

Returns

  • t_irf (numpy.ndarray) – The new time points.

  • y_irf (numpy.ndarray) – The convolved array.
